definitions: in the opposite direction from that in which a stream or river flows; nearer to the source

examples.text: a lone motor cruiser rumbled upstream
watch your footing and always face upstream
the Jubilee River relieves flooding upstream of Windsor

shortDefinitions: in opposite direction from that in which river flows

definitions: in or towards the part of a sequence of genetic material where transcription takes place earlier than at a given point.
shortDefinitions: in or towards part of sequence of genetic material

definitions: at a stage in the process of gas or oil extraction and production before the raw material is ready for refining.
shortDefinitions: at stage in process of gas or oil extractionl

definitions: moving or situated in the opposite direction from that in which a stream or river flows

examples.text: the upstream stretch of the river

shortDefinitions: moving or situated in opposite direction from that in which river flows

definitions: situated in or towards the part of a sequence of genetic material where transcription takes place earlier than at a given point.
shortDefinitions: situated in or towards part of sequence of genetic material

definitions: relating to the stages in the process of gas or oil extraction and production before the raw material is ready for refining.
shortDefinitions: at stage in process of gas or oil extractionl
